post_text: January 9, 2019 at 10:52 PM#1Hey all,I'm trying to write a macro that will assign a CMD to the first cue of an executor. In the CMD I'd like to use a variable. Is this possible?For example, I'm trying to change specialmaster 3.1 to BPM 120. In the macro I would use:setuservar $songbpm = 120Assign cue 1 /cmd = "specialmaster 3.1 at $songbpm"However, since it's in quotations, what is added to the CMD is '$songbpm' instead of 120.Is there any way to make a uservar work in quotations? Or is there another way that I'm not thinking of?

posts.post_text: January 10, 2019 at 4:30 AM#2Solved with help from FB:SetVar $songBPM = 120SetVar $cmd = “SpecialMaster 3.1 at “AddVar $cmd = $songBPMAssign cue 1 /cmd = $”cmd”
